name: Shepherd's Pie Potato Skins
description: Don't save the potato you scoop out for another dish - mash it and pile it on top to make these irresistible Shepherd's Pie Potato Skins!
recipeIngredient: 250 g / 8 oz   lamb or beef mince ((ground meat))
½  onion ((brown, white or yellow), diced)
1 1/2 cups frozen mixed vegetables ((pea, corn, carrots) (or fresh))
1 cup beef stock/broth ((or 1 stock / bouillon cube dissolved in hot water))
½ to 1 cup milk ((full or low fat))

itemListElement.text: Prick the potatoes with a fork (about 6 times on each potato) and microwave on high for 5 minutes. Then turn and microwave for a further 5 minutes. Pierce with a knife to check if they are cooked.
itemListElement.name: Prick the potatoes with a fork (about 6 times on each potato) and microwave on high for 5 minutes. Then turn and microwave for a further 5 minutes. Pierce with a knife to check if they are cooked.

itemListElement.text: Remove from microwave (use a dish cloth). Cut off the tops and scoop out the center using a spoon, leaving a fairly thin skin (about 0.5 cm / 0.2”).
itemListElement.name: Remove from microwave (use a dish cloth). Cut off the tops and scoop out the center using a spoon, leaving a fairly thin skin (about 0.5 cm / 0.2”).

itemListElement.text: Place the potato scooped out in a bowl. Add milk, butter and salt and mash with a potato masher until smooth, or to your liking.
itemListElement.name: Place the potato scooped out in a bowl. Add milk, butter and salt and mash with a potato masher until smooth, or to your liking.

itemListElement.text: If you want to pipe the filling, place the mashed potato into a piping back with a large star tip nozzle.
itemListElement.name: If you want to pipe the filling, place the mashed potato into a piping back with a large star tip nozzle.

itemListElement.text: Meanwhile, make the filling. Heat the olive oil in a large fry pan over medium high heat.
itemListElement.name: Meanwhile, make the filling. Heat the olive oil in a large fry pan over medium high heat.

itemListElement.text: Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2 minutes until softened.
itemListElement.name: Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2 minutes until softened.

itemListElement.text: Turn up heat to high. Add mince beef (ground beef) and cook, breaking up the mince as you go, until nicely browned and cooked – about 3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Turn up heat to high. Add mince beef (ground beef) and cook, breaking up the mince as you go, until nicely browned and cooked – about 3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle over flour and stir to combine.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle over flour and stir to combine.

itemListElement.text: Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Bring to simmer and continue to stir until the sauce is thick and glossy – around 2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Bring to simmer and continue to stir until the sauce is thick and glossy – around 2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Fill each potato with the Filling so it is slightly heaped. Push down lightly to pack the filling in well.
itemListElement.name: Fill each potato with the Filling so it is slightly heaped. Push down lightly to pack the filling in well.

itemListElement.text: Pipe over the mashed potato, or scoop it on with a spoon then fluff it up with a fork. You probably won’t use all of it – save the remainder or serve it on the side.
itemListElement.name: Pipe over the mashed potato, or scoop it on with a spoon then fluff it up with a fork. You probably won’t use all of it – save the remainder or serve it on the side.

itemListElement.text: Place in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the mashed potato is starting to brown on the ridges.
itemListElement.name: Place in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the mashed potato is starting to brown on the ridges.

review.reviewBody:
Followed the recipe but added Worcestershire sauce and Kitchen Bouquet to the meat and vegetables,and some shredded parm to the mash.

Very good!

Made this tonight for the family, the (at least) 30th recipeTin shopped for and made, and possibly at past the 50th made with a general guide... to ight, the fussiest of.ky eaters cake for seconds! THANK YOU, A NEW FAMILY FAVOURITE

I made this but instead of the cottage pie mixture, I filled it with Nagi’s meat pie mixture! I did a beef mince pie and added chopped mushrooms in it too. It was like a potato top mince and mushroom pie in a potato skin! 👌🏻

I didn’t love this, but I really wanted to. Seemed like the flavor of potato under and over the mixture really overpowered the flavor in the mixture - ending up making the dish seem pretty bland. The filling inside was not bland, though, so I think it’s just too much potato. Was a really fun idea though!

Shepherd's Pie cos sheep :-)
Therefore Cottage Pie must be beef.
Wonderful recipe!  Thank you so much! Everyone loves it.

I have made this recipe several times and it turns out great and deliciously great. Everyone is requesting for more. I mixed 30% ground pork with mince lamb. Much more smoother & not too dry. Thanks for the great recipe.
Delicious, great taste. Easy to make. Great flavor, everyone loved. Served with side salad.
When you freeze theses individually and take them out to thaw and reheat how long do you recook them and what temp?
